alert.note: Alert for Central Oregon Coast; North Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 12 at 3:30AM PST until January 14 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM FRIDAY TO 4 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations of a dusting up to 4 inches and ice accumulations of around 0.4 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 30 to 50 mph. * WHERE...North Oregon Coast and Central Oregon Coast. * WHEN...From 4 PM Friday to 4 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will likely begin Friday afternoon but will likely not accumulate on surfaces until later Friday evening. Freezing rain may begin Friday night, continuing through Saturday. It appears precipitation will fall mainly in the form of freezing rain. Very little to no snow or freezing rain is expected in the Florence area as temperatures will most likely stay above freezing that far south. However, uncertainty remains high regarding exact snow and ice amounts.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Central Oregon Coast; North Oregon Coast
